title: Unwrap on a None value

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code The project is >5000 lines of rust code + some protobuf definitions, so I can not include it here. The error happened when I removed an branch from a match block in an async function: ```Rust #[instrument(skip_all, name = "network-command")] async fn handle_command(&mut self, command: NetworkCommand) { match command { /* one field of NetworkCommand was missing here */ } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/std/src/panicking.rs:517:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/core/src/panicking.rs:100:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/core/src/panicking.rs:50:5 3: ::def_path_hash_to_def_id 4: rustc_middle::dep_graph::dep_node:: for rustc_span::def_id::DefId>::recover 5: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::force_query 6: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 7: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 8: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 9: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 10: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 11: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 12: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 13: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 14: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_load_from_disk_and_cache_in_memory 15: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query 16: ::evaluate_obligation 17: ::evaluate_obligation 18: ::evaluate_obligation_no_overflow 19: rustc_trait_selection::traits::fulfill::FulfillProcessor::process_trait_obligation 20: rustc_trait_selection::traits::fulfill::FulfillProcessor::progress_changed_obligations 21: rustc_data_structures::obligation_forest::ObligationForest::process_obligations 22: rustc_trait_selection::traits::fulfill::FulfillmentContext::select 23: ::select_all_with_constness_or_error 24: rustc_typeck::check::fn_ctxt::_impl::::select_all_obligations_or_error 25: rustc_typeck::check::wfcheck::check_false_global_bounds 26: rustc_infer::infer::InferCtxtBuilder::enter 27: rustc_typeck::check::wfcheck::check_item_well_formed 28: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task 29: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 30: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query 31: ::check_item_well_formed 32: ::visit_item 33: std::panicking::try 34: rustc_data_structures::sync::par_for_each_in 35: rustc_session::session::Session::track_errors 36: rustc_typeck::check_crate 37: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 38: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task 39: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 40: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query 41: ::analysis 42: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 43: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 44: rustc_span::with_source_map 45: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [evaluate_obligation] evaluating trait selection obligation `std::collections::hash::map::HashMap; 10]>>: core::marker::Send` | = note: this failure-note originates in the derive macro `NetworkBehaviour` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) #1 [check_item_well_formed] checking that `network::behaviour::` is well-formed #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `core-node` ```

I do not know what happened at all. There was an unhandled enum option somewhere in my code, but i was trying to compile anyway to view some warnings. After I added the missing enum field, everything worked fine. Hope this helps somehow.
